solution.text:
The surface area of the box \(= 2 (26 \times 11 + 11 \times 9 + 26 \times 9) = 1238 cm^2\)
Cost of painting the box = Rs. 1.8 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the box = \(1238 \times 1.8\)
= Rs. 2228.4

content.text: Latika needs to paint a rectangular box from the outside. The cost of painting the box is Rs. 1.8 per \(cm^2.\) If the dimensions of the box are \(26 cm \times 11 cm \times 9 cm\), what is the total cost of painting the box?

hint.text: Start by calculating the surface area

solution.text:
Total surface area of all the cubes \(= 5 \times 6 \times 2.3^2 = 158.7 cm^2\)
Area of each face =\(2.3^2 cm^2 = 5.29 cm^2\)
Number of faces that face inward = 10 faces
Therefore, outer surface area = 158.7 - 52.9 = 105.8 \(cm^2\)
Cost of paint = Rs 17 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the object = \(105.8 \times 17\)
= Rs. 1798.6

hint.text: Count the number of faces that are outward facing

solution.text: Surface Area of a cylinder = \(2 \times \pi \times r \times(r + h) = 5412 cm^2\)

content.text: In the cylinder below, diameter=42 cm, h=20 cm, find its surface area

solution.text:
Surface Area = Curved surface area of outer cylinder + Curved surface area of inner cylinder + Area of both rims
\(= 2\pi {r_ o}h + 2\pi {r_ i}h + 2\pi ({r_ o}^2 - {r_ i}^2)\)
\(= 4400 + 3960 + 477.71 = 8837.71 cm^2\)

hint.text:
Remember the following formulas:
Surface Area of the Cube:\( 6 \times side^2\)
Surface Area of the Cuboid: \(2 \times (lb + bh + lh)\)
Surface area of a cylinder:\(2\pi r(r+h)\)

content.text: The dimensions of a cuboid are in the ratio of 6:5:2 (l:b:h). If the total surface area is 104 \(m^2\). What is the length of the cuboid?
What is the Breadth of the cuboid?

solution.text:
Let length:breadth:height = 6x:5x:2x
Therefore, Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2(6 \times 5x^2 + 5 \times 2x^2 + 2 \times 6x^2)\)
= \(2(52)x^2\)
= \(104x^2\)
Given that surface area is \(104 m^2\)
Therefore, \(104 m^2 = 104 x^2\)
\(\Rightarrow x^2 = \frac{104}{104}\)
\(\Rightarrow x = \sqrt{1}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) x = 1 metres

solution.text:
Curved Surface area of the roller \(= 2 \pi rh = 2\pi \times \frac {8}2 \times 36 = 905.14 cm^2\)
Area covered per rotation \(= 905.14 cm^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Area painted in 51 rolls \(= 905.14 \times 51 = 46162.29 cm^2\)

content.text: Last Monday, Ram painted a rectangular wall with a cylindrical paint roller. The length of the roller is 36 cm and its diameter is 8 cm. While painting, the roller rolled over 51 times completely. What surface area did Ram paint?

hint.text: How much area does the roller cover in one rotation?

solution.text:
Total surface area \(= 2166= 6 (side)^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Length of side = \( \left(\sqrt {\frac {2166}{6}} \right) = 19 cm\)

content.text: A closed box in the shape of a cube has a total outer surface area of 2166 \(cm^2.\) What is the length of its side in centimetres?

hint.text: Remember that surface area of a cube is \(6 \times side^2\)

solution.text:
Area of tin sheet required for 1 box = Surface area of one box
\(= 2 (7 \times 9 + 9 \times 6 + 7 \times 6) = 318 cm^2\)
Therefore, area of tin required for 10 boxes \(= 318 \times 10\)
\(= 3180 cm^2\)
